title: Jackson returns in style as Ravens rout Dolphins
content: After starting 1-5, the Ravens have won two straight and Lamar Jackson has them in position for a possible run.

title: Woodward out as LSU AD amid Landry's criticism
content: Scott Woodward is out as LSU's athletic director, the school announced Thursday night, with the ouster coming in the wake of Gov. Jeff Landry's criticism of him earlier this week.

title: Lamar return has Ravens feeling 'dangerous' again
content: After missing three games because of a right hamstring injury, Ravens QB Lamar Jackson threw four touchdown passes in a 28-6 victory over the Dolphins on Thursday night.

title: Wemby leads Spurs to franchise's first 5-0 start
content: San Antonio, behind star Victor Wembanyama, is off to its hottest start in its 50 seasons in the NBA.

title: Sources: WNBA, players extend CBA for 30 days
content: The WNBA and WNBPA agreed Thursday to a 30-day extension of the current collective bargaining agreement through Nov. 30, sources confirmed.

title: Jeered in Miami, McDaniel shares fans' frustrations
content: Plagued by "self-inflicted wounds," the Dolphins fell to 2-7 after a sloppy 28-6 home loss to the Ravens in which they were loudly booed by fans throughout.

title: Sources: NBA, books review most vulnerable bets
content: The NBA and its partner sportsbook have had ongoing discussions on what types of bets are most vulnerable to manipulation and what betting limits are appropriate for such bets, sources told ESPN.

title: Ohtani roles for potential G7 include opener, OF
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts will consider using Shohei Ohtani as an opener or even as an outfielder in a potential Game 7 against the Blue Jays.

title: Jackson prevails in HBCU coaching clash vs. Vick
content: DeSean Jackson's Delaware State team defeated Michael Vick's Norfolk State 27-20 in a historic matchup of HBCU coaches.

content: At Week 9, what should fantasy managers believe, or not believe, about Drake Maye, Oronde Gadsden II and more?

content: Marcus Kowal, an ex-MMA fighter, wants to change American drunken driving laws after the tragic death of his 15-month-old son.

content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: How Zubeen Garg's Final Film Sparked Assam's Single-Screen Theatres' Revival
content: When the first show of 'Roi Roi Binale' began at 4:25 am in Guwahati on Friday, queues stretched down the street.

title: "Met Me Several Times In Jail": Samajwadi Party Leader On Bond With Akhilesh Yadav
content: Senior Samajwadi Party leader and former Uttar Pradesh minister Azam Khan has dismissed speculation of a rift with SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, asserting that the two share an unbroken political and personal bond spanning nearly 45 years.

title: Video: UAE Man's Drive Home Takes Longer Than Uncle's Flight To Pakistan
content: The man shared a video showing himself stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic after dropping his uncle at the airport.

title: Delhi Police Bust Cybercrime Syndicate Run By Indian Man Based In Dubai
content: The Delhi Police has busted a pan-India cyber fraud syndicate allegedly run by a Dubai-based Indian kingpin, arresting five people including a relationship manager of a bank for facilitating fraudulent financial transactions, officials said.

title: Israel Returns 30 More Palestinian Bodies To Gaza Under Ceasefire Deal
content: Israel has returned the bodies of 30 more Palestinians to Gaza as part of an ongoing exchange deal under a US-brokered ceasefire plan, a hospital told AFP on Friday.

title: 'American Dream For Americans': US Calls Out H-1B Visa 'Abuse' In New Video
content: A new video released by the Trump administration's Department of Labour on social media accused companies of abusing the H-1B visa program. It highlights that 72 per cent of visa holders are Indians, followed by Chinese at 12 per cent.

title: Pune Man Offers To Make Woman Pregnant After Reading Ad, Loses Rs 11 Lakh
content: Responding to an advertisement from a 'woman' seeking someone who could make her pregnant has led to a man from Pune being conned of Rs 11 lakh by cybercriminals.

title: Term Of Ladakh's 'Last Democratic Space' Ends With No Elections In The Offing
content: With no fresh elections to the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council in sight, the end of its five-year term has brought down the curtains on the Union Territory's democratic space.

title: 1 Killed, 55 Injured As Bus Carrying Pilgrims Overturns In Madhya Pradesh
content: A woman was killed, and 55 others sustained injuries after a bus carrying pilgrims for 'Narmada Parikrama' overturned in Madhya Pradesh's Barwani district on Friday morning, police said.

title: PM Modi Hails Demonstrations By Indigenous Dogs At Rashtriya Ekta Divas
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the demonstrations by indigenous dog breeds during the Rashtriya Ekta Divas (National Unity Day) celebrations at the Statue of Unity in Gujarat on Friday.

title: NASA Rejects Kim Kardashian's Claim That Moon Landing "Didn't Happen"
content: NASA hit back on Thursday at reality TV star Kim Kardashian's claim that the 1969 Moon landing "didn't happen," a theory consistently debunked over decades.

title: Xi Jinping Invites Canada PM To China In First Meet In 8 years
content: President Xi Jinping on Friday invited Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to China, in the first formal talks between the nations' leaders since 2017, before also holding first discussions with Japan's new premier.

title: NDTV Questions BJP Leader After 'VIP Brat' Thrashes Karnataka Toll Booth Worker
content: The manager of a highway toll booth in Karnataka where a boom operator was assaulted by the son of a BJP leader told NDTV they have not filed a case against the "brat" as they have left the matter for the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI).

title: Video: Bride's Father Sticks QR Code On Shirt For Cash Gifts At Wedding
content: In what is being called a new marriage trend, people were seen digitally transferring 'shagun' (blessing) to the newlywed couple. This also shows India's growing reliance on digital transactions.

title: 2 Kerala Nurses Save Passenger's Life Mid-Air Through CPR On Air Arabia Flight: Report
content: Two nurses from Kerala, travelling to Abu Dhabi from Kochi on their first international flight, saved the life of a fellow passenger after he suffered a cardiac arrest twenty minutes into the journey, local media reported.

title: Bomb Threat At Probe Agency's Office In Chennai Turns Out To Be Hoax
content: A bomb threat email sent to the Director General of Police (DGP)'s office in Chennai on Thursday morning led to a major security check at the Enforcement Directorate (ED)'s Southern Regional Office at Shastri Bhavan on Haddows Road.

title: "Love, Not Lust": Top Court After Victim Marries Man Who Sexually Assaulted Her
content: The Justice Datta-led Bench noted that during the pendency of the appeal, the appellant and the victim, now adults, had married in May 2021 and were leading a "happy married life" with a one-year-old son.

title: "I Don't Exist": British News Channel Anchor Reveals She Is AI-Generated
content: Aisha Gaban guided audiences through an investigation into automation’s impact on the workforce, but she turned out to be entirely AI-generated herself.

title: Narayana Health Expands into UK with Acquisition of Practice Plus Group Hospitals
content: Bengaluru-headquartered Narayana Health has announced the acquisition of UK-based Practice Plus Group Hospitals, marking its first major entry into the British healthcare market.

title: Video: BJP MP Rides Crane To Garland Statue, Slaps Operator After It Jolts
content: A celebration of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's birth anniversary turned into a scene of chaos and outrage in Satna on Friday afternoon after BJP MP Ganesh Singh slapped a municipal crane operator in public.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid edge Liverpool in Guéhi race
content: Real Madrid are leading the chase over Liverpool to sign Marc Guéhi from Crystal Palace in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Family escapes unhurt after mob attack over witchcraft allegations in Meghalaya; nine held
content: Preliminary inquiry said the violence stemmed from claims made by a boy, who alleged that he had "visions" and believed himself to be under a witchcraft spell

title: Gas turbine coatings power bacteria-driven electricity, find BITS-Pilani Hyderabad researchers
content: The coatings also demonstrated high stability and repeatability across multiple cycles, confirming their potential for long-term and scalable applications such as wastewater treatment plants and off-grid renewable energy setups

title: Traders disappointed as flood-prone Mamulpet in Bengaluru once again left out of road modernisation plan
content: Traders have argued that despite being among the city’s oldest and most economically significant markets, Mamulpet has been overlooked again while adjoining stretches such as B.T. Street and Rangaswamy Temple Street have been included in the project

title: Thunderstorms likely at isolated places in Andhra Pradesh from November 2
content: Except for these localised phenomenon, the State is unlikely to experience any significant rainfall, says  India Meteorological Department in Amaravati

title: Sengottaiyan expelled from AIADMK a day after meeting Panneerselvam, Dhinakaran, Sasikala
content: The dramatic turn of events merely a few months ahead of the Assembly polls in Tamil Nadu, have evidently presented fresh challenges to Mr. Palaniswami's leadership.

title: Gangster-turned-politician's death in Bihar: Medical board set up to supervise autopsy of body
content: Police had learnt that Dular Chand Yadav had received a bullet injury in his foot but died after being run over by a vehicle.

title: Electric vehicles represent future of mobility, says INCOSE president
content: Prasanna Ramamurthy says the automotive sector plays a pivotal role in driving economic growth, innovation, GDP, and employment; credits rapid expansion of the EV market to government incentives and affordable models

title: Delhi HC pulls up government; says don't entangle sports quota employees in protracted litigation
content: The Bench said it cannot remain oblivious to the manner in which Ajay Kumar, a sportsperson who has brought recognition and honour to the country, has been made to run from pillar to post for what was legitimately due to him.

title: Five officers elevated to IAS
content: The Department of Personnel and Training had on October 29 appointed S. Kavitha, C. Muthukumaran, P.S. Leela Alex, M. Veerappan and R. Revathi to the Indian Administrative Service for the Select List of 2023 on probation and allocated them to the Tamil Nadu cadre

title: Placement drive for skilled supervisors from Andhra Pradesh in Qatar’s oil and gas sector
content: Interested and eligible candidates may register themselves online by November 6, 2025, according to APSSDC Executive Director

title: Flight duty extension for Air India 787 pilots based on specific operational reasons: DGCA tells ALPA India
content: The Flight Duty Time Limitation has been increased to 10.30 hours from 10 hours, and the Flight Duty Period to 14.00 hours from 13:00 hours, says aviation regulator DGCA

title: Below-normal max temperatures expected in most parts of India in November: IMD
content: However, above-normal minimum temperatures are expected across most regions, except for some areas in the northwest

title: J&K Assembly Autumn Session adjourned sine die
content: "The members raised 97 issues during zero hour, which is unprecedented. I congratulate the members for raising the issues of their constituencies," speaker Abdul Rahim Rather said.

title: Have sought report on Mumbai hostage-taker Rohit Arya's work with education department: Maharashtra Minister
content: According to a government resolution of the School Education department dated January 25, 2024, Rohit Arya was the director of Project Let's Change, which ran the Swachhta Monitor initiative from July 20 to October 2, 2023

title: Third-semester exam results of plus-two level declared in Bengal, 93.72% qualify
content: The exams in semester format at the plus two level by any State board were the first such exercise in the country in sync with the State Education Policy, says Council president Chiranjib Bhattacharya

title: Daily Quiz | On Piyush Pandey
content: Advertising legend Piyush Pandey died at the age of 70 on October 24. A quiz on some of his iconic campaigns and ads.

title: Appellate Tribunal upholds attachment of Karti Chidambaram's properties under PMLA
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) in 2023 attached properties to the tune of ₹11.04 crore belonging to Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in the INX money laundering case, an official statement said.

title: Pallikaranai Ramsar site land dispute: Madras High Court stalls construction of high rise towers till November 12
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan direct the real estate developer not to construct until the ‘ground truthing’ exercise for fixing the boundaries of Ramsar wetland site is concluded in two weeks

title: Kerala LSG Minister M.B. Rajesh counters critics on extreme poverty-free declaration, says participatory process followed

title: Punjab DIG's judicial custody extended by 14 days in bribery case

title: One killed, 55 injures as bus carrying pilgrims overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Barwani

title: Mumbai hostage scare by Rohit Arya echoes past incidents
content: Mumbai’s recent hostage incident involving 17 children reflects the city’s history with similar tense situations and police responses

title: Behind closed doors: Odisha school closures fuel dropouts and educational challenges for tribal children
content: As per government statistics, the number of schools closed and merged with neighbourhood schools would be around 10,000 since 2013. Furnishing a reply in the State Assembly, School and Mass Education Minister Nityananda Gond in March 2025 said 5632 schools were closed and merged in the last five years.

title: Punjab Police dismantles cross-border arms smuggling module, seven held

title: India’s horticulture sector to get hi-tech boost with Dutch initiative for pesticide-free food production in high-end green houses
content: This initiative focuses on technologies and practices that help produce food crops in a climate resilient manner

title: Lok Sabha member Radhakrishna Doddamani seeks restoration of air services at Kalaburagi airport
content: Kalaburagi MP writes to Union Civil Aviation Minister Kinjarapu Rammohan Naidu seeking inclusion of airport under UDAN scheme

title: In my personal opinion, RSS should be banned, says Mallikarjun Kharge
content: They always tried to portray a rift between India’s first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru and Patel when they had great ties and both had praised each other, Mr. Kharge said

title: Centre allocates routes for Kerala’s seaplane project
content: Centre awards 48 seaplane routes, including in Kerala, to airlines under Regional Connectivity Scheme-UDAN of Union Ministry of Civil Aviation. The routes are allocated to IndiaOne Air, Maritime Energy Heli Air Services Pvt Ltd, PHL, and Spice Jet airlines

title: On Karnataka Rajyotsava day, Namma Metro to introduce fifth train on Yellow Line in Bengaluru
content: Commuters on Yellow Line, who have been facing severe overcrowding because of a limited number of trains, are expected to get some relief with the introduction of a fifth train

title: Nitish Kumar: the constant and the variable of Bihar
content: Nitish Kumar has taken oath as Chief Minister nine times — seven times with the support of the BJP and twice with the RJD

title: CreamCollar EduTech signs MoU with TN Auto Skills to upskill engineers in AI, automotive tech
content: As part of its academic collaboration initiative, CreamCollar will establish a Centre of Excellence (CoEs) for Software-Defined Vehicles in academic institutions and innovation hubs

title: Where the grid ends and gridlock begins: Anatomy of the ORR crisis in Bengaluru
content: What causes congestion on Outer Ring Road (ORR) in Bengaluru and why is a realistic and lasting solution to the ORR’s traffic woes elusive? Chetan B.C. explores answers

title: ‘Not allowing’ Nitish to speak at NDA's manifesto release insult to Bihar, claims Congress
content: Congress leader Ashok Gehlot criticises NDA’s 26-second manifesto launch, calling it a “string of lies” and questioning leadership transparency

title: Manuel Frederick, hockey player and Kerala’s first Olympic medallist, passes away
content: Manuel Frederick played for the Indian team for seven years, was honoured with the Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award in 2019 for his contributions to sports

title: Kerala CM showcases ‘extreme poverty eradication’ as crowning point of LDF government
content: In a statement on the eve of 69th Kerala Formation Day on November 1, Pinarayi Vijayan portrays the project to identify and eradicate extreme poverty as a ‘people’s movement’

title: Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences: Born out of a crisis, built to redefine care
content: Conceived in the shadow of COVID-19, the Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) was envisioned as a long-term response to the vulnerabilities that the pandemic exposed in the public healthcare system. Now nearing completion, the ₹1,070-crore, 1,000-bed TIMS facility at Sanathnagar in Hyderabad represents the State’s biggest leap toward an autonomous, next-gen government hospital model. As its opening draws near, Siddharth Kumar Singh examines whether it would live up to that promise or end up as a missed opportunity

title: 16 students injured in temporary gallery collapse in private college in Kerala
content: Gallery collapsed at Kottayam college during a programme for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel’s birth anniversary. The injured included NCC and NSS students

title: ‘Will prove our innocence’: T.N. Minister Nehru on ED’s claim of malpractices in his department
content: “The State police will scrutinise the documents and determine if any irregularities occurred. I have done nothing wrong,” he said

title: Five sentenced to death for murdering Chittoor mayor Katari Anuradha, husband
content: The court found all five accused guilty of murder and criminal conspiracy, and sentenced them to death

title: Ex-BJP MLA’s son assaults toll staff in Vijayapura in Karnataka, video goes viral, no case booked yet
content: A video clip of ex-BJP MLA Vijugouda Patil’s son and his aides allegedly assaulting toll booth staff in Vijayapura district has gone viral on social media

title: Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena assumes charge as Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief of Southern Naval Command
content: Vice Admiral Saxena, who was commissioned into Indian Navy on July 1, 1989 and is a specialist in navigation and direction, succeeds Vice Admiral V. Srinivas

title: Three terror suspects held in Rajasthan
content: Rajasthan’s Anti-Terrorism Squad detains three terror suspects during ongoing raids in Jodhpur and Jaisalmer

title: TMC leader flays bills to remove PM, CM detained for 30 days, says they undermine presumption of innocence
content: The TMC Rajya Sabha leader said the Bills claim to promote accountability, but on close inspection, they undermine the presumption of innocence.

title: Supreme Court asks Bar Council of India to notify polls for Punjab, Haryana bar councils; directs polls by December 31
content: Senior advocate Narender Hooda submitted that as per rules, the current body of Bar Council of India cannot continue beyond the tenure of seven years

title: CBI team visits Karur stampede site
content: The team, led by Praveen Kumar, Superintendent of Police, studied the topography of the area and the surrounding approach roads, including the spot where Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam president Vijay addressed massive crowds from his caravan

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin slams PM Modi’s remarks during Bihar election campaign
content: Mr. Stalin shared a video clip in which Mr. Modi was heard alleging that DMK members in Tamil Nadu were harming people from Bihar

title: Ford announces plan to revive Chennai plant with ₹3,250-crore investment
content: Representatives from Ford and the Tamil Nadu government signed a MoU with a focus on producing all-new, next-generation engines.

title: Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues shines as India beat Australia to reach World Cup final
content: Her composed knock helped India chase down 339 — the highest in Women’s ODI history — and secure a place in the November 2 final against South Africa. The innings has been hailed as a defining moment in Indian women’s cricket.

title: Lawyers cannot be summoned by probe agencies for their legal advice to clients: SC judgment
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and K. Vinod Chandran said advocates could be summoned by the agencies only in exceptional situations enumerated in Section 132 of the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam, 2023 (BSA)

title: Curriculum on AI to be introduced in all schools from Class 3 onwards: MoE
content: AI and Computational Thinking curriculum to start in all schools from Grade 3, enhancing future-ready education by 2026-27.

title: Telangana Intermediate Public Examinations-2026 from February 25, practicals from February 2
content: Special provision for practical exams if candidates’ exam date clashes with Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) schedule

title: Kolluru disaster response team rescues shepherd, 90 sheep from rising Krishna river
content: “Officials said the timely coordination between the community and the mandal emergency team exemplified the effectiveness of the district’s preparedness,” SDRF officials said

title: ‘Dies Irae’ movie review: Rahul Sadasivan delivers one of the finest horror films in Malayalam
content: In ‘Dies Irae’ starring Pranav Mohanlal, director Rahul Sadasivan crafts a chilling horror experience that transforms everyday moments into sources of dread, further proving his greatness in the genre

title: MEIL Energy acquires 250 MW power plant in Tamil Nadu
content: “Our focus remains on expanding our footprint across the energy sector through strategic investments that enhance national energy security, ensure reliable supply, and support India’s long-term growth,” MEIL Group CFO, Salil Kumar Mishra said

title: MLC Beeda Ravi Chandra serves defamation notice on Y.S. Bharati Reddy
content: Mr. Ravi Chandra called the reports that appeared in the Sakshi media as biased, partial and prejudiced

title: Bangladeshi man jailed for 8 years in rape case; two more get 5 years over illegal stay in India
content: According to the prosecution, Joshim Sobur Mulla (26) was accused of raping two minor girls trafficked from Bangladesh. Acting on a tip-off by an NGO, the police had rescued the survivors in 2017

title: Montha cyclone: Jagan Mohan Reddy’s comments ridiculous, says Yanamala Ramakrishnudu
content: “Jagan Mohan Reddy is caught in his own political calamity of losing out badly to the Telugu Desam Party-Jana Sena Party-BJP alliance in the 2024 elections,” Yanamala said

title: One crore jobs for youth, free education, and infra growth: NDA releases Bihar polls manifesto
content: The NDA, if voted to power, will also set up a world-class medicity, one medical college in each district, free ration, free treatment worth ₹5 lakh and 50 lakh more pucca houses, according to the 69-page manifesto

title: India, U.S. ink 10-year defence framework pact
content: Rajnath Singh who met his American counterpart Peter Hegseth, says the pact will provide policy direction in the entire spectrum of the India-U.S. defence relationship

title: Two die in elephant attack near Kerekatte in Sringeri taluk of Karnataka
content: Within a couple of hours after the incident, residents of Kerekatte and other villages in Sringeri taluk began a dharna demanding that the Deputy Commissioner of Chikkamagaluru district come to the spot

title: After 265 days, Kerala ASHA workers to end strike in front of Secretariat
content: Though the women health workers are ending their agitation in front of Secretariat in Kerala capital, they will continue their protest at the district level

title: Savita Samaj stages protest in Kalaburagi against derogatory remark by BJP MLC C.T. Ravi
content: Protesters led by Savita Samaj district president Anand Warik accused the BJP leader of using a prohibited and offensive term while referring to their community

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: Accused in custody for over five years, entitled to bail, SC told
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for Umar Khalid, told the Bench that there has been no recovery of funds, weapons or any material evidence linking him to the 2020 Delhi riots

title: VTU opens Centre of Excellence in AI, digital classrooms and library in Kalaburagi
content: The inauguration of these KKRDB-funded facilities marks a major milestone in VTU’s efforts to advance digital learning, promote skill-based education, and strengthen research in emerging technologies across the Kalyana Karnataka region

title: ‘Drone tech can help contain crop loss, promote biodiversity and soil health’
content: V. P. Chaudhary Principal Scientist, ICAR-Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering, Bhopal, spoke on the various aspects of drone application in agriculture at a workshop in UAS-Dharwad

title: 22-year-old criminal shot dead in northeast Delhi's Seelampur
content: The incident took place around 10.40 pm on October 30 when a firing was reported. On reaching the spot, police found a man with gunshot injuries lying near Jama Masjid in the area, they said

title: Jinnah, Savarkar behind India’s partition; BJP now dividing neighbourhoods: Digvijaya Singh
content: Digvijay Singh also said that ‘proofs of citizenship’ are being collected under the guise of the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists in the country.

title: How No. 11 Trinity Jones adds to a growing Clemson class; more girls' commit fits
content: there are 17 five-star recruits in the girls' SC Next 100 class of 2026 as of mid-october . the latest commitment comes from no. 11 Trinity Jones . we can make some informed projections . what's next for those programs that have signed these top-tier talents?

title: Tanzania crisis: Over 700 protesters dead, says oppn; what triggered unrest?
content: Tanzania's opposition party, Chadema, claims around 700 people have died in election protests, alleging widespread fraud. The government has imposed an internet blackout and curfew amid violent clashes between demonstrators and security forces. The UN has urged restraint and condemned the use of force.

title: No impact of US curbs? Russian oil continues to flow; Indian Oil buys more crude
content: Despite US pressure, Indian Oil Corporation has ordered five Russian crude oil shipments for December delivery from non-sanctioned entities. While some Indian refiners have suspended purchases due to sanctions, IOC plans to continue procuring Russian crude as long as it complies with regulations.

title: 'He fired, we retaliated': How Mumbai hostage drama turned fatal; cops share details
content: Social entrepreneur Rohit Aarrya, known for his work on Swachh Bharat and awareness videos, took 19 children hostage in Chembur. He claimed to have simple, moral demands and sought a conversation with unnamed individuals, threatening to harm the children if provoked. Aarrya stated his actions were part of a plan to conduct a 'Let's Change' program.

title: 'Sorry patra': Tejashwi, Cong tear into NDA's Bihar manifesto; mock press event
content: Bihar's ruling NDA alliance launched its election manifesto, "Sankalp Patra," promising jobs and development. The opposition Mahagathbandhan, led by Tejashwi Yadav, dismissed it as "jumla," demanding an apology for the state's alleged failures over 20 years of NDA rule. Congress echoed the criticism, questioning the manifesto's timing and the chief minister's limited role.

title: IND vs AUS: India batters poor; Australia take 1-0 lead
content: Australia secured a comfortable four-wicket victory over India in the second T20I at the MCG, taking a 1-0 series lead. India's batting faltered, managing only 125 despite Abhishek Sharma's 68, with Josh Hazlewood taking 3 wickets. Australia chased down the target in 13.2 overs, led by Mitchell Marsh's 46. The 3rd T20I will be played on Sunday, November 2.

title: Fried chicken frenzy: Nvidia CEO's dinner sparks stock rally; Huang effect
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's dinner with South Korean tech leaders sparked a significant rally in the nation's food sector, with shares of Kyochon F&B and poultry processor Cherrybro surging. The meeting, which included a symbolic gift of AI systems, underscored deepening commercial ties and demonstrated Huang's immense market influence beyond the tech industry.

title: Study in the UK: Autumn timelines decoded; why Indian students must start early
content: The United Kingdom continues to be a preferred destination for Indian students, especially for the Autumn Intake that starts each September or October. However, most applicants underestimate how early they must begin. By March, competitive courses begin reviewing applications, and by April, most scholarships close. Starting early—shortlisting, preparing statements, gathering references, and completing visa formalities—helps avoid the last-minute rush that often derails otherwise strong profiles.

title: Rs 2cr dues, moral demands: What triggered Rohit Aarrya’s hostage act in Mumbai - timeline of events
content: A social entrepreneur, Rohit Aarrya, held 17 children and others hostage in a Mumbai studio after feeling betrayed by the government over his civic initiative. The standoff ended in a police shootout, with Aarrya dead and the hostages rescued. His actions stemmed from a perceived lack of accountability and stolen ideas.

title: How to view 3I/ATLAS in the US
content: Discovered in early July 2025 by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) in Hawaii, 3I/ATLAS is moving on a hyperbolic path — meaning it’s not gravitationally bound to our Sun. It entered the solar system from deep interstellar space and will leave just as swiftly, never to return.

title: Tech stage banter: Samsung chief teases iPhone-using crowd with Nvidia CEO
content: Samsung Electronics chairman Lee Jay-young lightheartedly questioned the prevalence of iPhones at a tech event, drawing laughter and social media buzz. This playful jab occurred before a private dinner with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Hyundai Motor Group chairman Chung Eui-sun, highlighting their growing collaboration in AI and next-gen computing.

title: One crore govt jobs & more: NDA releases manifesto for Bihar polls; key promises
content: The NDA on Friday unveiled its Bihar election manifesto, promising one crore jobs, industrial growth, and major infrastructure projects. Released in Patna by CM Nitish Kumar and BJP leaders, it focuses on youth skills, women’s empowerment, and rural upliftment. The rival Mahagathbandhan pledges one job per family, OPS restoration, women’s aid, and 200 free electricity units.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: Tua Tagovailoa reacts as Dolphins hit rock bottom after Ravens loss
content: Miami Dolphins' season teeters on the brink after a dismal 28-6 loss to the Ravens. A players-only meeting followed, with quarterback Tua Tagovailoa admitting to "heartfelt conversations" about the team's mounting mistakes and turnovers. This defeat amplifies existing concerns about leadership and systemic issues, leaving fans questioning the team's ability to recover.

title: Jury orders NCAA to pay $18mn to ex-SC State star Robert Geathers and his wife
content: A South Carolina jury awarded $18 million to former South Carolina State player Robert Geathers and his wife, finding the NCAA negligent for failing to warn players about the long-term risks of concussions. Geathers, diagnosed with dementia and showing symptoms of CTE, played from 1977-1980. Attorneys argued the NCAA withheld crucial information about concussion dangers.

title: 'Extrajudicial killings': UN condemns US strikes on drug boats; calls for immediate halt
content: The UN has strongly condemned US strikes on vessels in the Caribbean and Pacific, allegedly carrying drug traffickers, calling them "extrajudicial killings." UN rights chief Volker Turk urged the US to halt these attacks, stating they violate international human rights law and have resulted in over 60 deaths since September. The UN is calling for an investigation into these incidents.

title: IND vs AUS: Surya loses toss again; has hilarious reaction - watch video
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav humorously reacted to losing another toss against Australia, suggesting an 'Aarti' to change their luck.  Despite the lighthearted moment, India's batters struggled, collapsing to 32/4 early on. Abhishek Sharma's 68 offered resistance, but India was bowled out for 125. The first T20I ended without a result due to rain.

title: 'A film about hostage situation': Actor reveals how she was approached by Rohit Aarrya
content: Marathi actress Ruchita Jadhav narrowly escaped a hostage situation after cancelling a meeting with Rohit Aarrya, the man who later held children and others captive. Aarrya, a self-styled filmmaker, was shot dead by police after a three-hour standoff. He had previously sought payment for a school cleanliness project.

title: INDW vs AUSW: 'Jemimah's century better than my '83 semi-final fifty', says Patil
content: India's women's cricket team secured a historic five-wicket win against Australia in the 2025 World Cup semi-final. This monumental victory has drawn parallels to the 1983 men's World Cup triumph, with legends like Sunil Gavaskar and Sandeep Patil lauding the performance.

title: TS Inter time table 2026: 1st and 2nd year exam dates out; full schedule here
content: The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education has released the IPE 2026 timetable for first and second-year students. Exams commence in late February and conclude in mid-March, with practical exams scheduled from February 2 to February 21. Hall tickets will be available approximately two weeks prior to the examinations.

title: Nasty! Shubman Gill hit on the head; falls for just five runs vs AUS
content: India's top order collapsed spectacularly in the second T20I against Australia, losing early wickets within the powerplay. Josh Hazlewood's fiery opening spell, including a blow to Shubman Gill's helmet, unsettled the batters. India found themselves in deep trouble at 92/5 after 13 overs, with their top order crumbling under pressure.

title: SpaceX reveals simplified Starship plan to speed up Artemis 3 moon mission
content: SpaceX has submitted a simplified Starship mission plan to NASA, aiming for a faster and safer lunar landing. This comes amid NASA's concerns about the rocket's readiness for Artemis III, with the agency reportedly facing internal pressures. SpaceX highlighted its development milestones and upcoming tests, including crucial in-space refuelling demonstrations.

title: IND vs AUS: A perfect reply to trolls? Harshit justifies Gambhir’s call
content: Team India all-rounder Harshit Rana impressed with a fighting 35 against Australia.  The Delhi pacer showed resilience with the bat after India's top order collapsed.  His innings validated Gautam Gambhir's faith in domestic talent.  Rana's performance highlighted the need for multi-dimensional cricketers in modern cricket.  He displayed courage and belief under pressure.

title: Rampage Jackson’s $1mn plea after UFC 321 hints at a shift in Dana White’s era
content: Former UFC champion Quinton “Rampage” Jackson urges the promotion to significantly increase fight bonuses to $1 million, arguing it will incentivize more exciting, knockout-focused fights. This call follows UFC 321's criticism for excessive ground control and a controversial no-contest, with Jackson believing higher rewards will foster 'real fights' and better entertainment for fans.

title: India win Women's World Cup? INDW beat SA by 100 runs, claims internet's 'encyclopedia'
content: Wikipedia users discovered a premature posting of the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final result, showing India defeating South Africa by 100 runs, despite the match being scheduled for Sunday. The fabricated scores contained mathematical errors, highlighting Wikipedia's open editing policy. Editors are expected to rectify such unauthorised modifications promptly.

title: ‘Break-up’ leave for Gen Z: Should bosses care? Boundaries and coping tips
content: A Gurugram startup employee’s candid email requesting “break-up leave” has sparked a nationwide debate on emotional transparency at work. As Gen Z blurs the line between personal and professional boundaries, experts are questioning whether workplaces should institutionalise such leaves. The viral incident underscores a generational shift prioritising mental well-being, empathy, and emotional authenticity over traditional notions of professionalism.

title: 5, 2, 1, 0, 5: India batters collapse like a pack of cards; Hazelwood breathes fire!
content: India suffered a disastrous start in the second T20I against Australia at the MCG, with their top five batters dismissed for single-digit scores. A devastating spell from Josh Hazlewood, coupled with a run-out, left India reeling at 5, 2, 1, 0, and 5. The top order struggled significantly against the Australian bowling attack.

title: Justin Bieber opens up on Twitch about the pain of staying vulnerable in fame
content: Pop sensation Justin Bieber recently revealed the emotional toll of online interactions during a Twitch stream. He shared that despite numerous positive comments, a single negative remark can deeply affect him, often stemming from others' insecurities. Bieber emphasized that putting himself out there authentically is challenging, even for a global star, highlighting the human side of fame.

title: Rare earth unlocked: China allows shipment to India — which sectors will benefit
content: China has resumed shipments of heavy rare earth magnets to India, providing relief to key manufacturing sectors. However, these crucial supplies come with a strict condition: the cargo cannot be re-exported to the United States, amidst ongoing trade tensions between the two global powers.

title: ‘Didn't see them as enemies’: Why Indian team shook hands with Pak players
content: Indian junior hockey players defied political tensions by sharing high-fives with their Pakistani counterparts after a draw, showcasing true sportsmanship. This gesture contrasted with the cricket team's stance, highlighting a different approach to rivalry. Both players are now set to compete in the Hockey India League, aiming to further develop their skills.

title: 'Within hours, she stopped breathing': MP infant dies after taking ayurvedic cough syrup
content: A heartbreaking incident unfolds in Chhindwara as a five-month-old baby tragically passes away after reportedly ingesting a contaminated ayurvedic cough syrup. This grim event adds to the distressing tally of over 24 child fatalities linked to a dangerous cough syrup. In response, the local pharmacy has been shut down, and authorities are launching a thorough investigation.

title: Sheikh Hasina reveals why she fled Bangladesh; calls August protests an 'insurrection'
content: Ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, speaking from exile, defended her departure from Bangladesh as a necessity for safety. She labeled the August protests a 'violent insurrection' and denied ordering security forces to fire on crowds, attributing casualties to 'breakdowns in discipline.' Hasina dismissed the International Crimes Tribunal proceedings against her as a politically motivated 'sham trial.'

title: Defying Trump's US manufacturing push? Ford returns to India with Rs 3,250 cr plan
content: Ford Motor Company is set to restart manufacturing in India. The automaker will invest Rs 3,250 crore in its Chennai facility. This move marks a significant return after exiting vehicle production in 2021. The plant will focus on engine manufacturing for export. Production is scheduled to begin in 2029. This project is expected to create over 600 jobs.

title: Dump it, face it: Bengaluru civic body dumps garbage back at litterbugs’ doorsteps
content: Bengaluru's 'Kasa Suriyuva Habba' anti-littering campaign booked 218 cases and collected Rs 2.8 lakh in fines on its launch day. The initiative aims to enforce cleanliness through penalties, with marshals monitoring and recording violations to deter public dumping and promote waste segregation.

title: Punjab: 3 SFJ operatives arrested for writing pro-Khalistan graffiti on schools’ walls
content: Authorities have apprehended three individuals linked to the banned Sikhs for Justice group for allegedly painting pro-Khalistan slogans on school walls in Punjab. Police investigations suggest these acts were funded from abroad and aimed at inciting unrest. The swift action by Counter Intelligence and local police underscores a commitment to national security and peace within the state.

title: How to watch interstellar comet 3I ATLAS passing through the solar system
content: A rare interstellar visitor, comet 3I/ATLAS, is currently traversing our solar system, offering scientists a unique chance to study an object from another star.  This comet, unlike those orbiting our Sun, follows a one-time hyperbolic path.  Best viewing opportunities are in the eastern predawn sky mid-to-late November 2025, requiring at least an eight-inch telescope.

title: Delivery scam: Bengaluru techie loses Rs 1.86 lakh; unboxes tile instead of smartphone
content: A Bengaluru techie was defrauded of ₹1.86 lakh after ordering a high-end smartphone online and receiving a tile instead. The victim, Premamananda, had purchased a Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7. He has filed a complaint with KS Layout Police, who are now investigating the delivery scam.

title: Mumbai shocker: Doctor stabbed by hospital staffer’s kin over ‘affair’; 2 arrested
content: A 26-year-old doctor at KEM Hospital was allegedly attacked and stabbed by the brother and friends of a female hospital staff member over their alleged relationship. Two individuals, Farid Khan and Nabeel Khan, have been arrested for assault and attempt to murder. The doctor sustained minor injuries and is out of danger.

title: ‘It was raining ...’: Cong recalls Indira’s 1977 Bihar visit; posts pics of her on elephant
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh commemorated Indira Gandhi's 41st death anniversary, highlighting her "uncommon grit, courage, perseverance, and resilience." He recalled her 1977 visit to Belchhi, Bihar, where she rode an elephant to meet victims of caste atrocities, a journey seen as a political revival. Other Congress leaders also paid tribute, remembering her as the "Iron Lady of India."

title: Delhi doctors reconstruct 20-year-old’s thumb; use toe from amputated leg
content: In a remarkable feat of medical innovation, doctors in New Delhi have successfully reconstructed a young accident victim's thumb using his own second toe. The patient, who lost his leg and thumb in a severe road accident, underwent a complex microsurgical procedure.

title: 42-year-old chef diagnosed with breast cancer after ignoring this key symptom
content: A 42-year-old chef's battle with aggressive male breast cancer, a rare but serious condition, underscores the importance of vigilance. Despite initial dismissal of a chest lump, his diagnosis highlights that men are not immune. Early detection is crucial, as symptoms like lumps or nipple changes can be easily overlooked.

title: Hailee Steinfeld opens up on marriage doubts with Josh Allen and life beyond fame
content: Actress Hailee Steinfeld candidly shared her journey of adjusting to married life with NFL star Josh Allen.  She revealed the emotional shift from Hollywood's fast pace to a more grounded existence, emphasizing the need to redefine her rhythm.  Fans are applauding her honesty about the challenges and growth involved in their high-profile union.

title: 'New chapter': Rajnath meets Hegseth amid US tariff row; 10yr defence framework signed
content: India and the US have signed a landmark ten-year Defence Framework Agreement, marking a new era of defense cooperation. The pact, inked by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth, outlines a roadmap for enhanced military collaboration and joint initiatives across the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Gold price today: What is the gold rate today? Check cost of 24K, 22K gold in your city
content: Gold prices experienced a dip in domestic futures trade on Friday, influenced by the Federal Reserve's stance on interest rate cuts and a temporary truce in US-China relations. Despite this, global gold prices saw a slight increase. The article also provides a city-wise breakdown of gold rates for both 24K and 22K purity.

title: NFL Week 9 arrivals, featuring Dolphins' Aaron Brewer's Michael Myers mask
content: week 9 of the season marks another opportunity for players to make the most of their fits . the calendar entered the first week of November, but that didn't put an end to summer weather fits, or mark the beginning of cozy looks . here's a look at the top fits from week 9 .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: When will Rodri fully return to form?
content: pep Guardiola reveals how far forward is from returning to action . the spaniard has missed the last four games since suffering a knee ligament injury . he has returned to full training with the squad in a 2-0 win over Bournemouth .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, Halloween identity for teams
content: this week's Power Rankings include a Halloween costume or identity for all 32 teams . a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . the previous edition, published Oct. 24, generates our list .

title: The unhittable pitch rocking this MLB postseason -- and the aces who will be throwing it in World Series Game 6
content: two of the foremost practitioners of the pitch that has defined October will duel at Rogers Centre . los Angeles Dodgers right-hander Yoshinobu Yamamoto is trying to save his team's season . the rise of the splitter over the past half a decade has transformed baseball even more than the cuttee .

title: Back to Toronto! Here's what each team needs to do to win it
content: the 2025 world series is back in Canada for Game 6 on friday night . the Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from dethroning the Los Angeles Dodgers . if they finish the deal at Rogers Centre or will the Dodger team rebound? who is the world Series MVP through five games?

title: Projecting Jai Lucas' first top commitment as Miami head coach, more recruit fits
content: there are currently 19 five-stars atop the SC Next 100 player rankings for the men's college basketball class of 2026 . six are off the board, with Miami getting its first top commitment of the Jai Lucas era in no. 16 Caleb Gaskins .

title: Class rankings: Texas Tech climbs; fallout from firings continues
content: the player rankings update helped classes at Texas Tech, Indiana and Minnesota climb . the bigger picture to watch is how the slew of current and potential job openings will impact the class rankings . classes at Florida and LSU bring a great deal of intrigue as they are ranked inside the top 15 .

title: Second-half predictions: Who will win tight division races, MVP and the Super Bowl?
content: Damien Woody says Drake Maye is the best quarterback from the 2024 draft class . seven teams that missed the postseason in 2024 have a .500-or-better record this season . about 64% of games have been within one score (eight points) in the fourth quarter .

title: Despite the chaos, Bill Belichick and UNC seem to be improving. Is it enough?
content: bill Belichick delivered a sermon to the nonbelievers . he was not making changes to his staff after a 2-3 start and a blowout loss to Clemson . belichick says his team is better than what it was at the end of spring ball .

title: 🎃 LeBron announces Halloween children's book
content: "Happy Spooky Halloween" is a 32-page picture book with illustrations by Ariel Landy . the book is set to release on July 21 by publisher HarperCollins . "you guys know how much I love Halloween and this one's going to be special," James says .

content: Advitya Bahl is a crime reporter with the Times of India's Noida edition.  With nearly a decade of experience covering both high and medium level criminal cases, court trials, and police investigations, he has built sources within the beat with reputation, integrity, and impactful storytelling. Advitya's  work sheds light on systemic flaws in law enforcement and brings voices to the fore. Read More

title: How Rs 50 bribery charge ruined TTE’s career; name cleared — long after his death
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most."
